business.headline: Sensex, Nifty fall after Trump's fresh tariff threat over Russian oil importsThe S&P BSE Sensex fell 156.96 points to 80,861.76 around 9:23 am, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 30.80 points to trade at 24,691.95. Most of the broader market indices also mirror the weak sentiments on Dalal Street.

Worried about ethanol-blended petrol? Government says it's safe for your vehiclesIn a post on X (formerly Twitter), the ministry responded to recent media reports questioning whether E20 fuel could damage older vehicles or degrade the driving experience. Citing multiple studies and expert assessments, it stated that E20 is both safe and beneficial.

Anil Ambani leaves for Delhi, to appear before ED in loan fraud case todayThe summons against Anil Ambani followed a massive crackdown by the ED last month, during which the agency searched 35 premises linked to some top executives of the Reliance Group.

Thousands of Boeing fighter jet workers go on strike after rejecting contract offerOver 3,200 workers have walked off the job in what marks their first strike in nearly 30 years. The affected workers, primarily based in the St. Louis region, are responsible for assembling and maintaining military aircraft, including the F-15 fighter jet and various missile systems.

After Mumbai, Tesla to open showroom in Delhi's Aerocity on August 11The Delhi showroom will be opened at Worldmark 3 in Aerocity for customers. Like the Mumbai showroom, this showroom is also expected to serve as a display and customer experience centre, offering visitors a chance to view the vehicles up close and understand Tesla's technology.

Tesla's brand loyalty took a hit after Musk backed Trump as US President: ReportThe data shows Tesla's customer loyalty peaked in June 2024, when 73% of Tesla-owning households in the market for a new car bought another Tesla, according to an S&P analysis of vehicle-registration data in all 50 states.

Sunjay Kapur's death: Mother alleges foul play, transnational conspiracy in letterSunjay Kapur passed away on June 12 while playing polo at the Duke's Ground of the Old Guards Polo Club in Surrey, UK. His death was officially described as a heart attack. However, his mother Rani now claims there may be more to the story.

How to activate UAN via UMANG app to access EPFO servicesEPFO now requires everyone to activate their UAN through the UMANG app using Aadhaar-based face authentication to access provident fund services.

Tesla offers Elon Musk $29 billion deal to stay onboardIn 2018, Tesla had promised Musk a huge $50 billion pay package if he hit certain performance goals. But earlier this year, a court in Delaware cancelled that deal, saying the company's board didn't do a fair job protecting shareholders when they approved it.

ED's crackdown on Anil Ambani, web of bank frauds: All you need to knowThe fraud case centres around unpaid loans amounting to nearly Rs 17,000 crore, which were taken by various firms linked to Anil Ambani. Officials are now trying to trace the money trail and who were all involved in diverting it.

Are you unemployed or studying? Should you file taxes this yearIf your total income is below the basic exemption limit, Rs 2.5 lakh under the old tax regime or Rs 3 lakh under the new one, you are not legally required to file an ITR. This means many students and unemployed individuals fall outside the mandatory filing bracket.
Sensex closes 418 points higher, Nifty above 24,700; Tata Steel ends 4% upThe S&P BSE Sensex added 418.81 points to close at 81,018.72, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 157.40 points to end at 24,722.75.

entertainment.headline: Exclusive: Ahn Hyo-seop on KPop Demon Hunters, Jinu's sacrifice, Jungkook's reactionKPop Demon Hunters, a record-breaking animated musical on Netflix, brings to life Jinu, a demon idol voiced by Ahn Hyo-seop in his first voice acting role. In an exclusive chat, the actor-singer breaks down his process and why he feels Jinu's sacrifice is the most Jinu thing he could do. He also mentioned why he wants to visit India someday.

Telugu producer's council calls for non-union professionals amid workers' strikeThe Telugu Film Industry Employees' Federation initiated a strike on August 4, demanding a 30 per cent hike in fees for workers. A day later, the Telugu Film Chamber of Commerce called for non-union professionals to work with them upon agreeing to pay.

Actor Shehnaaz Gill hospitalised, Bigg Boss fame Karan Veer Mehra visits herActor Shehnaaz Gill has been hospitalised due to a sudden health scare, with reports suggesting low blood pressure. Fellow actor Karan Veer Mehra visited her and shared a video urging fans to pray for her speedy recovery.
Lady Gaga to release new track Dead Dance for Netflix's Wednesday 2Lady Gaga is set to contribute a new track for Netflix's 'Wednesday Season 2'. The song has been titled 'Dead Dance'.

Katy Perry's fan faints on stage mid-show, singer halts concert to assist herAt her Detroit concert, Katy Perry showed true compassion by pausing her performance when a fan collapsed. Called McKenna, the fan was then assisted by paramedics.

Why a female-led Ullozhukku's National Award win feels personalUllozhukku challenges traditional portrayals of women in Indian cinema by showcasing complex female characters and their bonds. The film won Best Malayalam Film and Best Supporting Actress at the 71st National Film Awards, receiving critical acclaim for its direction and performances.

Hansika deletes wedding video, Insta posts with husband, sparks divorce rumoursActor Hansika Motwani deleted posts, including her wedding video with Sohael Khaturiya, from Instagram. Speculations about their divorce after this action. The couple had a widely-publicised wedding in December 2022.

We know it's because of Empuraan: Urvashi on National Award snub of AadujeevithamActor Urvashi, who received Best Supporting Actress for 'Ullozhukku' at the 71st National Awards, questioned why Prithviraj and director Blesssy's 'Aadujeevitham' was ignored.  She also stated that she needs to speak up for younger generation of artistes.

Zakir Khan recalls not recognising BTS band members in Korea: Was totally unawareComedian Zakir Khan recently shared a funny story about meeting BTS in Korea without recognising them. He confessed to realising the popularity of the K-Pop icons much later.

Vivek Agnihotri says Sandeep Reddy Vanga is his alter ego: He is showing the truthDirector Vivek Agnihotri defended 'Animal' director Sandeep Reddy Vanga's storytelling approach. He claimed that Vanga is criticised because of jealousy over his success rather than his content.
Adivi Sesh, Emraan Hashmi's G2 gets a release date. See new posterActor Emraan Hashmi, Adivi Sesh, and Wamiqa Gabbi's much-anticipated spy thriller 'G2' gets a release date.

Rajinikanth compares Lokesh Kanagaraj to SS Rajamouli at Coolie eventRajinikanth praised Lokesh Kanagaraj at the Telugu pre-release event of 'Coolie'. He compared him to SS Rajamouli ahead of 'Coolie's release on August 14.

Priyanka Chopra to team up with Bhansali for Love & War? Here's what we knowPriyanka Chopra is rumoured to be a part of Sanjay Leela Bhansali's 'Love & War'. However, as per an industry source, the reports are untrue.

Stranger Things Seasson 5 twist revealed, setting up wildest cold open yetNetflix is set to release the highly anticipated fifth season of 'Stranger Things' in three instalments. The makers dropped a major hint about the new seaosn.

Sabrina Carpenter performs at Lollapalooza with Earth, Wind and Fire bandSinger Sabrina Carpenter's performance at Lollapalooza is taking social media by storm. She performed with the Chicago-based band Earth, Wind, and Fire. Her videos from the event are going viral.

Hrithik Roshan is all praise for War 2 co-star Jr NTR, calls him incredibleActor Hrithik Roshan spoke highly of co-star Jr NTR at an event in Sri Lanka and the video is now going viral. The much-anticipated film from the YRF Spy Universe, 'War 2' will be released on August 14.

Jatadhara 1st look: Sonakshi Sinha enters a mythic supernatural realmThe first poster of Sonakshi Sinha's 'Jatadhara' is out. The poster shows the clash of mortal and mythical in a supernatural realm.

Kerala Minister V Sivankutty questions National Award snub for AadujeevithamEducation Minister V Sivankutty questions the omission of the Malayalam film Aadujeevitham from the National Film Awards. The controversy highlights possible jury politics and technical criticisms surrounding the film.

Aamir Khan hosts movie night with his Coolie gang, watches Sitaare Zameen ParBollywood actor Aamir Khan got together with his 'Coolie' team to watch 'Sitaare Zameen Par' in his vanity van after the recent pre-release event that took place in Chennai. Lokesh Kanagaraj, Nagarjuna, Shruti Haasan, Upendra and others can be seen in the pictures.

general news.headline: India defies Trump and Europe on Russian oil imports, points out their duplicityNew Delhi, responding to US President Donald Trump's threat to substantially hike tariffs on the buying and selling of Russian oil, said India is being targeted in an "unjustified and unreasonable" manner.

Exhibit A of US lies, hypocrisy over India and Russian oilAs Donald Trump threatens India over Russian oil trade, a video of former US Ambassador Eric Garcetti admitting that the US encouraged India to buy Russian oil to keep global prices in check is now widely circulating.

Why this August 5 is a big day for Amit ShahBJP leader Amit Shah became India's longest-serving Home Minister on August 5, the day on which Article 370 was revoked, by surpassing the record of party veteran LK Advani. Shah played a key role in Art 370 revocation, which Advani had championed. Other than 370, curbing Naxal violence and spearheading the passage of the CAA are among the highlights of Shah's stint.

Trump's name blacked out in Epstein files after FBI review: ReportFBI agents were instructed to flag any reference to Trump while combing through the Epstein files in March, Bloomberg reported citing sources. Trump's name was blacked out by investigators as it constituted an "unwarranted invasion of privacy".

Spirited India level England series, but Gambhir's Test reign must end nowIndia's Oval win was a testament to their grit and tenacity — but it came in spite of their head coach, not because of him. Individual brilliance papered over deep tactical flaws and inconsistent selections throughout the series. With just 3 wins in their last 13 Tests, Gautam Gambhir's tenure as Test coach should end sooner rather than later.

Anil Ambani leaves for Delhi, to appear before ED in loan fraud case todayThe summons against Anil Ambani followed a massive crackdown by the ED last month, during which the agency searched 35 premises linked to some top executives of the Reliance Group.

Worried about ethanol-blended petrol? Government says it's safe for your vehiclesIn a post on X (formerly Twitter), the ministry responded to recent media reports questioning whether E20 fuel could damage older vehicles or degrade the driving experience. Citing multiple studies and expert assessments, it stated that E20 is both safe and beneficial.

How Modi's 'swadeshi' call gives India's economic nationalism a new voiceThe Varanasi pitch looks timed to Donald Trump's new tariff threat. Yet, to become policy, Modi's 'swadeshi' must avoid the trappings of India's 'conservative' industrialism

Giants exit, heirs rise: India's NextGen batting stars hold the fort in EnglandIn the absence of Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli, it was Shubman Gill's authority, KL Rahul's elegance, Ravindra Jadeja's determination, Rishabh Pant's swagger, Yashasvi Jaiswal's promise, and Washington Sundar's grit that carried India forward in England.
Flipkart Freedom Sale: Tablets Get Their Biggest Price Drop of the YearFor buyers looking to invest in a new device, this could be the best chance before the festive season arrives.

To be a friend...: BJP leader invokes Henry Kissinger amid Trump's tariff threatsAs India navigates through Donald Trump's threat over its oil trade with Russia, BJP leader Baijayant Panda invoked Henry Kissinger's quote to highlight the evolving diplomatic situation.

After Mahua Moitra's 'pig' jibe, Kalyan Banerjee's furious post and a resignationTrinamool Congress MP Kalyan Banerjee responded to Mahua Moitra's statement where she referred to him as "pig", calling them dehumanising and unfortunate. He also resigned as the party chief whip in Lok Sabha.

Why a female-led Ullozhukku's National Award win feels personalUllozhukku challenges traditional portrayals of women in Indian cinema by showcasing complex female characters and their bonds. The film won Best Malayalam Film and Best Supporting Actress at the 71st National Film Awards, receiving critical acclaim for its direction and performances.

Indian families face tougher vetting under new US green card rulesUSCIS has tightened rules for family-sponsored green cards, increasing scrutiny that could impact thousands of Indian applicants already facing long backlogs and complex documentation requirements.

We will never surrender: Gautam Gambhir's first reaction to India's Oval Test winIndia vs England, 5th Test: Head coach Gautam Gambhir took to social media to laud the young team's fighting spirit after they won the Oval Test by six runs. India fought back from 1-2 down to level the series and retain the trophy.

India's hard-hitting response after Trump's fresh tariff threat: Key pointsThe Ministry of External Affairs, in a strongly worded statement, said that India's oil imports are guided by national interests and rejected what it described as "unjustified and unreasonable" pressure from Western powers.

Why Mahjong is beating screen timeA centuries-old Chinese tile game is turning into the new favourite amongst all age groups. People are putting down their screens and coming together for a fun Mahjong session.

Nothing will happen tomorrow: Omar Abdullah amid J&K statehood buzzThe buzz around J&K's statehood to be restored started after President Droupadi Murmu had back-to-back meetings with Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Union Home Minister Amit Shah.

US plans visa bond rule: Up to $15,000 for business, tourist applicantsThe US will launch a visa bond pilot program on August 20, requiring up to $15,000 from visitors from high overstay-risk countries to curb illegal immigration and visa violations.

We know it's because of Empuraan: Urvashi on National Award snub of AadujeevithamActor Urvashi, who received Best Supporting Actress for 'Ullozhukku' at the 71st National Awards, questioned why Prithviraj and director Blesssy's 'Aadujeevitham' was ignored.  She also stated that she needs to speak up for younger generation of artistes.

35 runs from hell: How Shubman Gill's India scripted epic comeback at OvalIndia defended just 35 runs on the final day of the 5th Test match at Oval. Shubman Gill and Mohammed Siraj broke down India's plan coming into Day 5 and how they bowled an incredible set of 53 deliveries to demolish England.

Why Gen Z and Millennials are betting on holiday home rentals for passive incomeThis generational shift is rewriting the rules of property ownership. No longer is real estate only a legacy asset handed down across decades. Today, it's a cash-flowing tool for freedom, lifestyle, and even content creation.

Punjab village bans love marriages without family consent, sparks rowThe resolution, passed unanimously on July 31, prohibits couples who marry without the approval of their families from residing in the village or nearby areas. It also warns of punitive action against any villagers who support or shelter such couples.

5 illegal Bangladeshis arrested for forcibly trying to enter Red Fort: CopsFive Bangladeshi nationals, living illegally in India, were arrested near Red Fort after they allegedly tried to enter the premises without valid passes, officials said.

Exclusive: Ahn Hyo-seop on KPop Demon Hunters, Jinu's sacrifice, Jungkook's reactionKPop Demon Hunters, a record-breaking animated musical on Netflix, brings to life Jinu, a demon idol voiced by Ahn Hyo-seop in his first voice acting role. In an exclusive chat, the actor-singer breaks down his process and why he feels Jinu's sacrifice is the most Jinu thing he could do. He also mentioned why he wants to visit India someday.

Telugu producer's council calls for non-union professionals amid workers' strikeThe Telugu Film Industry Employees' Federation initiated a strike on August 4, demanding a 30 per cent hike in fees for workers. A day later, the Telugu Film Chamber of Commerce called for non-union professionals to work with them upon agreeing to pay.

Why a female-led Ullozhukku's National Award win feels personalUllozhukku challenges traditional portrayals of women in Indian cinema by showcasing complex female characters and their bonds. The film won Best Malayalam Film and Best Supporting Actress at the 71st National Film Awards, receiving critical acclaim for its direction and performances.

Hansika deletes wedding video, Insta posts with husband, sparks divorce rumoursActor Hansika Motwani deleted posts, including her wedding video with Sohael Khaturiya, from Instagram. Speculations about their divorce after this action. The couple had a widely-publicised wedding in December 2022.

sports.headline: Spirited India level England series, but Gambhir's Test reign must end nowIndia's Oval win was a testament to their grit and tenacity — but it came in spite of their head coach, not because of him. Individual brilliance papered over deep tactical flaws and inconsistent selections throughout the series. With just 3 wins in their last 13 Tests, Gautam Gambhir's tenure as Test coach should end sooner rather than later.

Absolute Scenes! Gambhir leads wild dressing room celebrations after Oval winAn emotional Gautam Gambhir led the way with the celebrations inside the dressing room as India clinched a memorable win at the Oval against England. India were able to level the series with the win on Monday, August 4.

Giants exit, heirs rise: India's NextGen batting stars hold the fort in EnglandIn the absence of Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli, it was Shubman Gill's authority, KL Rahul's elegance, Ravindra Jadeja's determination, Rishabh Pant's swagger, Yashasvi Jaiswal's promise, and Washington Sundar's grit that carried India forward in England.

The Siraj bhai series: Out of Bumrah's shadow, ruling India's heartsIndia vs England: Across five punishing Tests, Mohammed Siraj bowled his heart out, emerging as India's new bowling leader. In a series shaped by pressure and fatigue, he reminded us what playing for the country still means, even in an era of changing priorities.

Wipe out the word workload from Indian cricket's dictionary: Sunil GavaskarLegendary Sunil Gavaskar has called to wipe out the word workload from the dictionary of Indian cricket. Speaking on India Today, Gavaskar took the example of brave heart Mohammed Siraj, whose spirited spell on the final day of 5th Test helped India level the series.

Captain Shubman Gill gets a thumbs up from Sunil Gavaskar after Oval Test winSpeaking to India Today, legendary Sunil Gavaskar heaped praise on Shubman Gill's record-breaking batting effort in the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy. The batting great also lauded Gill's captaincy, saying it was instrumental in helping India win the Oval thriller on Monday morning.

Bhai, I am really tired: Siraj's brother recalls chat with gladiatorial pacerIn an exclusive interview with Rajdeep Sardesai, Mohammed Ismail, brother of Mohammed Siraj, spoke about the Indian pacer's relentless 'never die' attitude - shaped in the streets of Hyderabad - and his rise from tennis-ball cricket to the highest level of the game.

No pay for Sunil Chhetri: BFC suspends salaries amidst ISL uncertaintyIndian Super League club Bengaluru FC have announced that they have suspended salaries of the first team players and staff amidst uncertainty in Indian football. The moves comes amidst speculation about ISL's future.

ENG vs IND Report Card: A+ for Siraj and Gill, Karun-Sudharsan disappointIndia's thrilling win at the Oval sealed the Test series in a 2-2 draw. The five-match affair saw several notable performances from the Indian team. Shubman Gill and Mohammed Siraj have the top honours but the jury's out regarding Sai Sudharsan and Karun Nair for different reasons.

Siraj earns Ben Stokes' respect after Oval heroics: Always admired himMohammed Siraj earned the respect of England captain Ben Stokes for the sheer effort he put in across the five Tests of the inaugural Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy. Siraj redefined the concept of workload management, bowled his heart out throughout the series, and finished as the leading wicket-taker.

We will never surrender: Gautam Gambhir's first reaction to India's Oval Test winIndia vs England, 5th Test: Mohammed Siraj and Shubman Gill spoke to the press on Monday after India pulled off a heroic 6-run win. The duo reflected on India's fighting skills and 25 days of hard-fought cricket in the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy.

Bhai, I am really tired: Siraj's brother recalls chat with gladiatorial pacerIn an exclusive interview with Rajdeep Sardesai, Mohammed Ismail, brother of Mohammed Siraj, spoke about the Indian pacer's relentless 'never die' attitude - shaped in the streets of Hyderabad - and his rise from tennis-ball cricket to the highest level of the game.

No pay for Sunil Chhetri: BFC suspends salaries amidst ISL uncertaintyIndian Super League club Bengaluru FC have announced that they have suspended salaries of the first team players and staff amidst uncertainty in Indian football. The moves comes amidst speculation about ISL's future.

ENG vs IND Report Card: A+ for Siraj and Gill, Karun-Sudharsan disappointIndia's thrilling win at the Oval sealed the Test series in a 2-2 draw. The five-match affair saw several notable performances from the Indian team. Shubman Gill and Mohammed Siraj have the top honours but the jury's out regarding Sai Sudharsan and Karun Nair for different reasons.

Siraj earns Ben Stokes' respect after Oval heroics: Always admired himMohammed Siraj earned the respect of England captain Ben Stokes for the sheer effort he put in across the five Tests of the inaugural Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy. Siraj redefined the concept of workload management, bowled his heart out throughout the series, and finished as the leading wicket-taker.

We will never surrender: Gautam Gambhir's first reaction to India's Oval Test winIndia vs England, 5th Test: Mohammed Siraj and Shubman Gill spoke to the press on Monday after India pulled off a heroic 6-run win. The duo reflected on India's fighting skills and 25 days of hard-fought cricket in the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
